column4: I have a usb wireless card, and I don't even know if it's working.
How do I know if my wireless device is working?
You can connect to the internet? :P
Then its not working :O
try "lsusb" and looking for your wireless usb thing. Is it linksys?
/msg me
Ok are you using ndiswrapper?
Try "lsusb" and see what number it spits out for your wireless adapter
Inside a terminal, open up gnome-terminal or something
What do I do with the number that lsusb spits out?
Give it to me :P
here
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/WifiDocs/Driver/Ndiswrapper?action=show&redirect=SetupNdiswrapperHowto
Thats a complete tutorial on how to get it working
Yep, just follow through the thing completely
How can I be sure that it's not working already?  Because honestly, I don't know.
You can try "ifconfig" to see what interfaces you are, and then "iwlist (interface) scan"
But if it doesn't work, then you probably won't find stuff.
Sorry, if you don't find stuff, it won't work, and you need to follow the tutorial.
what should i see with ifconfig andiwlist
Ok, type iwconfig. you might see things like "eth0" or "wlan0" or something... try going "iwlist eth0 scan" or "iwlist wlan0 scan"
